messages.message: so i made a cypress-ci sandbox against the crafting-cyp infra, but looks like it's not loading for some reason? https://crafting-cyp--pr-58478-instabase.instabase.site.sandboxes.run/

> EvalError: Refused to evaluate a string as JavaScript because 'unsafe-eval' is not an allowed source of script in the following Content Security Policy directive: "script-src 'self' www.google-analytics.com (http://www.google-analytics.com) www.googletagmanager.com (http://www.googletagmanager.com) cookie-cdn.cookiepro.com (http://cookie-cdn.cookiepro.com) js.stripe.com (http://js.stripe.com) 'nonce-K_rpG7nSavVVuWVUg5RsURXwDjAVTX0xvPtK8qZL36E'".
does there need to be some CSP stuff happening or whatever
Yeah @mfichman actually just fixed the database for crafting-cyp, so things should be looking better!
(at least confirmed I can load converse projects now)
I did apply a CSP disable patch yesterday though, strange it got overwritten :thinking_face:

Also, if anyone is looking to test intercepted services against the new infra, follow these steps first (they're annoying now but will be one command in the near future):
1. `cs sandbox update -D 'dev/env[NAMESPACE]=intes-use2-crafting-cyp-instabase' -D 'dev/env[CONNECTED_INFRA]=crafting-cyp'`  -- run from sandbox command line
2. log out of your command line session, then log back in
3. `workspace setup`
